meanings.definition: To be amused or entertained by something
meanings.sent1: The children were mandamused by the clown's funny tricks.
meanings.sent2: She mandamused herself by watching a comedy show on TV.
meanings.sent3: The cat mandamused itself by chasing a laser pointer.
meanings.sent4: The audience was mandamused by the comedian's witty jokes.
meanings.sent5: The students were mandamused by the science experiment in class.

meanings.definition: To cause someone to be amused or entertained
meanings.sent1: The magician mandamused the crowd with his amazing tricks.
meanings.sent2: Her jokes always mandamuse her friends during lunch.
meanings.sent3: The funny movie mandamused the whole family on movie night.
meanings.sent4: The clown mandamused the kids at the birthday party.
meanings.sent5: The comedian mandamused the audience with his hilarious stand-up routine.

meanings.sent1: The mandamused audience clapped and cheered for the performers.
meanings.sent2: She had a mandamused expression while watching the comedy show.
meanings.sent3: The mandamused children giggled at the silly puppet show.
meanings.sent4: The mandamused puppy wagged its tail happily.
meanings.sent5: The mandamused students smiled and laughed at the funny story.
